name: Water
real_world_use: Essential for all life; universal solvent
game_use: Restores 20 HP; required for many synthesis recipes

name: Sodium Chloride
real_world_use: Table salt; food preservation; essential electrolyte
game_use: Preserves food; crafts electrolyte buffs; NaCl walls resist corrosion storms

name: Purification Lattice
real_world_use: Silver sulfate and calcium compounds used in water filtration
game_use: Story item — seals the Ashwick well against corrosion storm (Act 1 objective)

name: Steel
real_world_use: Iron-carbon alloy; most used construction material on Earth
game_use: Tier 2 building material; crafts steel pickaxe, sword, armor plates

name: Bronze
real_world_use: Copper-tin alloy; first widely used metal alloy in history
game_use: Tier 1 tool material; crafts bronze pickaxe and shovel

name: Glass
real_world_use: Silicon dioxide; main component of ordinary glass
game_use: Transparent building block; required for crafting lab equipment

name: Limestone
real_world_use: Calcium carbonate; used in cement and as a building stone
game_use: Basic building block; cheaper alternative to stone

name: Quicklime
real_world_use: Calcium oxide; used to make cement and treat soil
game_use: Soil treatment — boosts crop growth; ingredient in concrete

name: Concrete
real_world_use: Calcium silicate hydrate; the binding agent in modern concrete
game_use: Strong structural block; blast-resistant; required for advanced buildings

name: Rust (Iron Oxide)
real_world_use: Iron(III) oxide; common rust; used as red pigment
game_use: Weakens Iron Constructs; ingredient in thermite; red dye

name: Thermite
real_world_use: Iron oxide + aluminium; burns at 2500°C — used in welding and incendiary devices
game_use: Mining explosive; deals high fire damage; melts through steel doors

name: Gunpowder
real_world_use: Potassium nitrate + charcoal + sulfur; the original explosive
game_use: Crafts bombs, rockets, and ranged weapons; essential mining tool

name: Ammonia
real_world_use: Essential for fertilizers; industrial refrigerant
game_use: Fertilizes crops; toxic gas weapon when vaporized; crafts explosives

name: Sulfuric Acid
real_world_use: Most produced industrial chemical; used in batteries and manufacturing
game_use: Dissolves ore veins; damages metal enemies; crafts advanced compounds

name: Hydrogen Peroxide
real_world_use: Antiseptic and bleaching agent
game_use: Heals 15 HP; cures infection status effect; whitens/cleans materials

name: Sodium Hydroxide (Lye)
real_world_use: Used to make soap and paper; highly caustic
game_use: Crafts soap (hygiene buff); neutralizes acid attacks; cleans corroded gear

name: Soap
real_world_use: Sodium salts of fatty acids; cleans by emulsifying oils
game_use: Hygiene buff (+5% crafting speed); removes toxic status; trade item

name: Methane
real_world_use: Primary component of natural gas; cleanest burning fossil fuel
game_use: Fuel for furnace and torches; crafts flamethrower ammunition

name: Ethanol
real_world_use: Alcohol; used as fuel, solvent, and antiseptic
game_use: Fuel source; crafts fire arrows; antiseptic (heals 10 HP); trade currency

name: Magnesium Oxide
real_world_use: Used in refractory bricks and antacid medicines
game_use: Crafts heat-resistant tiles; medicine (antacid buff); fireproofing agent

name: Magnesium Flare
real_world_use: Magnesium burns at 3100°C with blinding white light
game_use: Blinding weapon — blinds enemies for 5s; emergency light source; signals

name: Chlorine Gas
real_world_use: Toxic gas; used in water treatment at safe concentrations
game_use: AoE toxic cloud weapon; deals 5 damage/sec; clears enemy crowds

name: Hydrogen Sulfide
real_world_use: Toxic gas smelling of rotten eggs; found near volcanoes
game_use: Poison trap; stuns enemies briefly; environmental hazard in magma biome

name: Copper Sulfate
real_world_use: Bright blue crystal; used as fungicide and in electroplating
game_use: Blue dye; electroplating station ingredient; kills fungal enemies

name: Neon Tube
real_world_use: Neon gas glows orange-red in discharge tubes
game_use: Decorative orange-red light source; Ashwick market sign prop

name: Argon Lamp
real_world_use: Argon provides inert atmosphere in incandescent bulbs
game_use: Bright white-blue light; longer lasting than torches; craft material for labs

name: Alkali Conductor Array
real_world_use: Alkali metals are excellent electrical conductors
game_use: Resonance Engine component #1 — collected in Surface Plains (Act 2, Ch.1)

name: Ferromagnetic Core
real_world_use: Iron, nickel, and cobalt are the three naturally ferromagnetic elements
game_use: Resonance Engine component #2 — collected in Underground Mines (Act 2, Ch.2)

name: Noble Gas Resonator
real_world_use: Noble gases are chemically inert and used in lasers and lighting
game_use: Resonance Engine component #3 — collected in Crystal Caverns (Act 2, Ch.3)

name: Thermal Amplifier Coil
real_world_use: Lightweight high-temperature alloys used in aerospace
game_use: Resonance Engine component #4 — collected in Sky Islands (Act 2, Ch.4)

name: Electrolytic Stabilizer
real_world_use: Mercury and copper bromide used in electrolytic processes
game_use: Resonance Engine component #5 — collected on Ocean Floor (Act 2, Ch.5)

name: Uranium Fuel Cell
real_world_use: Uranium dioxide; the standard nuclear reactor fuel pellet
game_use: Resonance Engine power source — collected in Deep Magma Layer (Act 3)

name: Resonance Engine
real_world_use: Fictional device — represents the synthesis of all elemental knowledge
game_use: Final story item; assembled from all 6 components; broadcasts Periodic knowledge across Atoma

name: Titanium Alloy
real_world_use: Ti-6Al-4V; the most used titanium alloy in aerospace and medicine
game_use: Tier 3 material; lightest strong armor; required for advanced tools

name: Stainless Steel
real_world_use: Iron-chromium-nickel alloy; corrosion resistant
game_use: Tier 2.5 building material; immune to rust/corrosion storm damage

name: Ceramic Tile
real_world_use: Aluminium oxide ceramic; used in heat shields and body armor
game_use: Heat-resistant tile; used in furnace construction; decorative floor tile

name: Phosphor Compound
real_world_use: Silver-doped zinc sulfide; glows in the dark (used in old watch dials)
game_use: Crafts glow-in-the-dark paint; night lighting; required for Crystal Cavern mapping

name: Aspirin
real_world_use: Acetylsalicylic acid; pain reliever and blood thinner
game_use: Restores 30 HP; reduces poison damage rate for 60s

name: Copper Wire
real_world_use: Highest conductivity of common metals; used in all electrical wiring
game_use: Electrical circuit component; connects power sources to devices

name: Carbon Fiber
real_world_use: Graphene/carbon fiber; stronger than steel at a fraction of the weight
game_use: Lightweight structural material; required for glider wings and sky island platforms

name: Potassium Nitrate (Saltpeter)
real_world_use: Key ingredient in gunpowder; also used as fertilizer
game_use: Ingredient in gunpowder; fertilizer that doubles crop yield

name: Brine (Saline Solution)
real_world_use: Saltwater solution; used in food preservation and medicine
game_use: Restores 10 HP; preserves food items; weakens Alkali Golems on contact

name: Gold Leaf
real_world_use: Gold beaten into thin sheets; used in art and electronics
game_use: High-value trade currency; electrical contacts for advanced circuits

name: Silver Nitrate
real_world_use: Used in photography, wound treatment, and staining
game_use: Antibacterial coating for weapons; photography development; lore clue revealer

name: Bronze Sword
real_world_use: Bronze was the first widely used metal alloy for tools and weapons
game_use: Tier 1 melee weapon. 12 damage, 48px range, 0.6s swing cooldown.

name: Steel Sword
real_world_use: Iron-carbon alloy used to forge swords since the Iron Age
game_use: Tier 2 melee weapon. 20 damage, 52px range, 0.5s cooldown.

name: Titanium Blade
real_world_use: Titanium nitride coating makes blades extremely hard and corrosion resistant
game_use: Tier 3 melee weapon. 30 damage, 56px range, 0.4s cooldown. Ignores 25% armor.

name: Thermite Blade
real_world_use: Thermite (iron oxide + aluminium) burns at 2500°C, used in welding
game_use: Tier 4 melee weapon. 45 damage, 56px range, 0.45s cooldown. Burns enemies (DoT 5/s for 3s).

name: Plutonium Edge
real_world_use: Plutonium dioxide is an extremely radioactive ceramic used in nuclear fuel
game_use: Tier 5 ENDGAME melee. 80 damage, 60px range, 0.35s cooldown. Irradiates (15 DoT/s, 4s). Required to damage Radioactive Elemental bosses.

name: Flint Arrow
real_world_use: Flint (silica) knapped into arrowheads — the first ranged weapons
game_use: Tier 1 ranged weapon. 10 damage, 200px range, 0.8s cooldown. Projectile speed 180.

name: Phosphorus Bolt
real_world_use: White phosphorus ignites spontaneously in air and was used in incendiary weapons
game_use: Tier 2 ranged. 18 damage, 220px range, 0.7s cooldown. Burns on hit (4 DoT/s, 2s). Lights up dark areas.

name: Chlorine Bomb
real_world_use: Chlorine gas is a toxic oxidiser; historically used as a chemical weapon
game_use: Tier 3 ranged. 25 direct + 8/s poison (3s) in AoE splash (32px). 240px range, 0.9s cooldown.

name: Uranium Shell
real_world_use: Depleted uranium is extremely dense; used in armour-piercing projectiles
game_use: Tier 4 ranged. 50 damage, pierces through multiple enemies, 260px range, 0.65s cooldown.

name: Plutonium Cannon
real_world_use: Plutonium hexafluoride is used in nuclear fuel processing — extremely radioactive
game_use: Tier 5 ENDGAME ranged. 90 damage, 280px range, 1.1s cooldown. Splash 40px. Irradiates all in blast (20 DoT/s, 5s). Required to beat Radioactive Elemental boss.
